name: Atkinson, Richard C.
title: President Emeritus; Professor Emeritus of Cognitive Science and Psychology, UC San Diego
ngos: National Academy of Sciences (member); National Academy of Medicine (member); National Academy of Education (member); American Academy of Arts and Sciences (member); American Philosophical Society (member); American Association for the Advancement of Science (past president); Association of American Universities (former chair)
notes: 17th President of the University of California (1995-2003); Chancellor of UC San Diego (1980-1995); 5th Director of the National Science Foundation (1977-1980), appointed by President Jimmy Carter; negotiated first US-China science exchange agreement; challenged SAT I as UC admissions requirement; Stanford University faculty 1956-1975.

name: Brady, Patrick H. USA (Ret)
title: Major General, U.S. Army (Retired)
ngos: Congressional Medal of Honor Society (past president); National Medal of Honor Museum Foundation (board member)
notes: Medal of Honor recipient (Vietnam War, January 6, 1968) for helicopter rescues of 51 wounded soldiers under enemy fire; one of only two men to receive both the Medal of Honor and Distinguished Service Cross in Vietnam; flew over 2,000 combat missions; evacuated more than 5,000 wounded; retired as Major General after 34 years of service (1993); endorsed Donald Trump for president in 2024; received 2025 Great American Patriot Award from Armed Forces Insurance.

name: Doumani, Peter J.
title: Independent Consultant (Litigation Finance, Dispute Resolution, Real Estate, Insurance)
notes: California State Bar attorney (license #52999); extensive background as State Court Receiver in contentious real estate and business disputes; former partner in property management company specializing in distressed properties; UCLA undergraduate (1965) and UCLA Law School graduate (1969); born in Berlin, Germany (1942), immigrated from Mexico in early 1950s.

name: Finger, Jonathan S.
title: Managing Partner
ngos: Texas Gulf Bank (board member); Alley Theatre, Houston (board member); Rice University Jones Graduate School of Business (adjunct professor)
notes: Houston-based single-family office managing inherited wealth; former Senior VP at Charter National Bank (1990-1997); former investment banker at Drexel Burnham Lambert (M&A) and Lehman Brothers (equity research); MBA from Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania; BA from University of Virginia.

name: Fraser, Michael Edward
title: Independent Chairman
ngos: Orora Limited (director); Clean Energy Council (former chairman); Elgas Limited (former chairman); ActewAGL (former chairman); Aurizon Holdings Limited (former director); Queensland Gas Company Limited (former director)
notes: Australian energy executive; Managing Director and CEO of AGL Energy for seven years until February 2015; over 40 years of experience in the Australian energy and infrastructure sectors; background in taxation, chartered accounting, and the Australian Taxation Office before joining AGL.

name: Gordon, Lindsay H.
title: President & CEO (retired)
ngos: University of British Columbia (Chancellor 2014-2020); Business Council of BC (board member); Junior Achievement Canada (governor); C.D. Howe Institute (director); Export Development Canada (director); Clear Seas Centre for Responsible Marine Shipping (director); CHILD Foundation (co-founder); United Way Lower Mainland of BC (past campaign cabinet chair)
notes: Longest-serving CEO in HSBC Bank Canada history; joined HSBC (then Hongkong Bank of Canada) in 1987; served as President & CEO from October 2003 until retirement in January 2013; born in Shetland Islands; immigrated to Canada 1970; BA Economics from UBC (1973); received 2010 B'nai Brith Award of Merit, 2012 Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Medal; died August 26, 2024.

name: Hecht, Kenneth G. Jr.
title: Of Counsel
notes: Specializes in employee relocation, corporate, and real estate law; more than 40 years of nationwide experience in relocation and home sale transaction disputes; former General Counsel and Secretary of Transamerica Relocation Services, Inc.; former partner at Plageman Lund & Cannon LLP, Robbins Palmer & Allen LLP, and Rubin Eagan & Feder P.C.; JD from IIT Chicago-Kent College of Law; BS from University of the Pacific; Worldwide REC Distinguished Service Award and 2006 President's Award recipient; California Bar #46786.

name: Huddlestone, Roger
title: Co-founder / Principal
notes: California Licensed Real Estate Broker since 1980; co-launched Black Oak Ventures with Vern Padgett providing privately funded debt bridge finance for real estate investors; primary service area San Francisco Bay Area; UC Berkeley and St. Mary's College alumnus; lives in Lafayette, California.

name: Kelley, Kevin F.
title: Attorney / Partner
notes: Over 35 years of experience in California business law; specializes in agricultural businesses, real estate development, and tax planning; founded Berliner Cohen's Merced office (1994) and Modesto office (2012); served as City Attorney of Gustine, CA (January 2000 to December 2005); represents generational agricultural family businesses and venture funds in San Joaquin Valley.

name: Kirkorian, Roy
title: Co-Owner
notes: Born August 5, 1945 in Fresno, California; telecommunications executive turned private investor and craft beer entrepreneur; worked at law firms 1971-1975; Assistant VP Legal at Continental Telephone Corporation 1975-1978; VP Legal and Secretary of Continental Telecom Inc. 1978-1983; President of Contel Texocom 1983-1986; President and COO of CP National Corporation 1987-1989; private investor since 1989; co-purchased Drake's Brewing with John Martin in 2008; merged with Bear Republic Brewing in 2023; co-founder of West Coast Craft JV with Figueroa Mountain Brewing (2026).

name: McCaw, Bruce R.
title: Co-founder; private investor
political_donations: Donated $2,800 to Alek Skarlatos congressional campaign
ngos: Apex/Bruce & Jolene McCaw Family Foundation (Vice President and co-founder); Dee Howard Foundation (board member); Behind the Badge Foundation (founding director and board member); Seattle Opera (board member); Congressional Medal of Honor Foundation (board member); National Air and Space Museum (Trustee Emeritus); Talaris Research Institute (former co-chair); Washington State University Foundation (former trustee)
notes: Born June 26, 1946 in Seattle; co-founder of McCaw Cellular Communications (sold to AT&T for $11.5 billion in 1993); co-founded Westar Insurance Co. (aviation and specialty insurance) and Horizon Air (regional airline); founded PacWest Racing Group (Champ Car, 1993-2002); inducted into Living Legends of Aviation (2005); received Washington Policy Center Stanley O. McNaughton Champion of Freedom Award (2007); holds commercial and instrument pilot ratings; brother of Craig, John, and Keith McCaw; net worth estimated at approximately $700 million.

name: Mutton, Nicholas
title: Chair, Board of Trustees (retired Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts)
ngos: Santa Barbara Museum of Art (Chair, Board of Trustees; Co-Chair, Fundraising Committee)
notes: 35-year career at Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts; opened two 5-star hotels in London in the late 1960s and early 1970s; emigrated to North America in 1975 to join Four Seasons; Fellow of the Institute of Hospitality (FIH); born and raised in the Cotswolds, England; UK roots, Los Angeles-area presence; became Chair of Santa Barbara Museum of Art board for 2021-22.

name: Newman, Scott Winthrop
title: President
notes: Oakland, California based; associated with thirteen companies formed over a twenty-one year period, with four still active.

name: Parry, Dana G.
title: President & Chief Executive Officer
notes: Over 20 years of experience in commercial real estate development; Reynolds & Brown is a San Francisco East Bay Area-based commercial real estate development and property management firm founded in 1963; expertise in project acquisition, entitlement, financing, tax planning, real estate law, project management, construction, marketing, leasing and disposition; BA from VMI and USC; JD from UCLA School of Law; member of the State Bar of California and licensed real estate broker.

name: Protopappas, John
title: President & CEO
political_donations: Served as campaign treasurer for Governor Jerry Brown; associated with Governor's Residence Foundation (CFO and director)
ngos: Summit Bank (board of directors); Oakland Alameda County Coliseum Foundation (board); Oakland Police Foundation (board); UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital (board); Port of Oakland Board of Commissioners (2000-2007; president 2004-2005)
notes: Real estate developer and investor; founded Madison Park Financial Corporation (Oakland, CA); developed over 60 commercial and residential projects including Tribune Tower and Bakery Lofts in Emeryville; AB in Economics from UC Berkeley; friend and former landlord of Governor Jerry Brown; served as Brown's campaign treasurer; co-founder of Oakland Housing Foundation.

name: Reynolds, Jon Q.
title: Co-founder / Chairman
ngos: Urban Land Institute (trustee, 12 years; past chairman, Industrial and Office Park Council; member, Urban Land Foundation); Oakland Housing Foundation (founding chairman); UC Berkeley Fisher Center for Real Estate and Urban Economics (former chairman, Policy Advisory Board); Oakland/Alameda County Coliseum Board (commissioner); East Bay Municipal Utility District (board member, 9 years; chairman, 5 years); Oakland Housing Authority (commissioner); Cal Trans Airspace Advisory Commission (member)
notes: 44 years as investment developer; co-founded Reynolds & Brown in 1967 (established 1963); firm has developed over 8 million square feet of office, retail, flex, industrial, and mixed-use space in San Francisco Bay Area; appointed by Governor to California Military Base Reuse Task Force; UC Berkeley graduate.

name: Sulpizio, Robert E.
title: Expert Witness and Risk Management Consultant
notes: Nationally recognized expert witness in property/casualty insurance; more than forty years of experience as P&C underwriter and senior executive at leading international insurance brokerage firms; testified in California, Arizona, Georgia, and Maryland courts; has provided testimony to California Public Utilities Commission on wildfire liability insurance issues; contact: resulpizio.com; related to Sulpizio family donors to UCSD Sulpizio Cardiovascular Center.

name: Sultan, Ed
title: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
notes: Chairman and CEO of Na Hoku, Hawaii's oldest and largest fine jewelry manufacturer (founded 1924); joined family business in 1985; co-launched Na Hoku brand in 2000 with partner Steve Bookatz; grew company to 17th largest fine jewelry business in North America with 63+ locations; graduated from Punahou School (class of 1981) and University of Colorado; grandfather Edward D. Sultan founded Sultan Foundation Nursery School (1946), predecessor to Easter Seals Hawaii; family has deep philanthropic ties to disability services in Hawaii.
